tool.name: bcftools @EXECUTABLE@
tool.description: VCF/BCF conversion, view, subset and filter VCF/BCF files

param.name: force_samples
param.label: Force Samples
param.help: Only warn about unknown subset samples

param.name: no_update
param.label: No Update
param.help: Do not (re)calculate INFO fields for the subset (currently INFO/AC and INFO/AN)

param.name: trim_alt_alleles
param.label: Trim Alt Alleles
param.help: Trim alternate alleles not seen in the subset

param.name: min_ac
param.label: Min Ac
param.help: (-c --min-ac) Minimum count for non-reference (nref), 1st alternate (alt1), least frequent (minor), most frequent (major) or sum of all but most frequent (nonmajor) alleles

param.name: max_ac
param.label: Max Ac
param.help: (-C --max-ac) Maximum count for non-reference (nref), 1st alternate (alt1), least frequent (minor), most frequent (major) or sum of all but most frequent (nonmajor) alleles

param.name: select_genotype
param.label: Select Genotype
param.help: Include only sites with one or more homozygous (hom), heterozygous (het) or missing (miss) genotypes. When prefixed with ^, the logic is reversed. Please notice that if the input file doesn't have any genotype columns, then this option is ignored altogether.

param.name: types
param.label: Select Types
param.help: List of variant types to select. Site is selected if any of the ALT alleles is of the type requested. Types are determined by comparing the REF and ALT alleles in the VCF record.

param.name: exclude_types
param.label: Exclude Types
param.help: List of variant types to exclude. Site is excluded if any of the ALT alleles is of the type requested. Types are determined by comparing the REF and ALT alleles in the VCF record.

param.name: known_or_novel
param.label: filter known or novel ID
param.option: (-k) print novel sites only (ID column is ".")
(-n) print known sites only (ID column is not ".")

param.name: min_alleles
param.label: Min Alleles
param.help: (-m) Minimum number of alleles listed in REF and ALT (e.g. -m2)

param.name: max_alleles
param.label: Max Alleles
param.help: (-M) Maximum number of alleles listed in REF and ALT (e.g. -M2 for biallelic sites)

param.name: phased
param.label: filter phased
param.help: Haploid genotypes are considered phased. Missing genotypes considered unphased unless the phased bit is set.
param.option: (-p) print sites where all samples are phased
(-P) exclude sites where all samples are phased

param.name: min_af
param.label: Min Af
param.help: (-q) Minimum frequency for non-reference (nref), 1st alternate (alt1), least frequent (minor), most frequent (major) or sum of all but most frequent (nonmajor) alleles

param.name: max_af
param.label: Max Af
param.help: (-Q) Maximum frequency for non-reference (nref), 1st alternate (alt1), least frequent (minor), most frequent (major) or sum of all but most frequent (nonmajor) alleles

param.name: uncalled
param.label: filter on genotype uncalled
param.option: uncalled - print sites without a called genotype
exclude-uncalled - exclude sites without a called genotype

param.name: private
param.label: filter on private
param.help: Private: Where only the subset samples carry an non-reference allele. ( Ignored if samples are not included )
param.option: (-x) private - print sites where only the subset samples carry an non-reference allele
(-X) exclude-private - exclude sites where only the subset samples carry an non-reference allele

param.name: drop_genotypes
param.label: Drop Genotypes
param.help: Drop individual genotype information (after subsetting if -s option set)

param.name: compression_level
param.label: Compression Level
param.help: Compression level: 0 uncompressed, 1 best speed, 9 best compression

param.name: invert_targets_file
param.label: Invert Targets File
param.help: Inverts the query/filtering applied by Targets File
